Hey all, we have been thinking about the a number of proposals which have been made (immutables/constructor arguments for account creation, account introspection) and summarised our thoughts in this document: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/eof2-proposal

Feedback encouraged üôÇ

author: lightclient
content: EOF cut from shanghai - thanks for everyone's hard work over the past few weeks. I think without everyone's input we wouldn't have been able to get to this place in the first place! I hope we can still keep some momentum in the mean time and tighten EOF up so that we can ship it in cancun!

author: chfast
content: The EOF spec is frozen and super stable, but please check https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6261.

author: lightclient
content:
> Also, as  long as the EOF breakout room has at least a productive 30 minute meeting, perhaps we should just make it every week there is not an ACED meeting - <@403707149043105803> 

I'm happy to continue running these - is there a time that we would like to commit to a reoccurring call every 2 weeks (off cycle of ACD ((yes ACD)))?

author: _shemnon
content: Opposite the CL call may be problematic as there may be cross-interest.  I'm thinking Wed or Fri at the ACD time

author: lightclient
content: Slight pref for Friday personally!

author: timbeiko
content: 1h later is _much_ better for west coast people fwiw, but don't block just on me üòÑ

author: _shemnon
content: Im cool with friday 1 hour later, or even friday 1 hour later set to a US time zone and not UTC.

author: timbeiko
content: Hopefully EOF breakouts end before DST üòõ

author: lightclient
content: Anyone oppose strongly 7am PT on Fridays for continued breakout calls? ( üëç time is good, üëé time is bad )

author: _shemnon
content: Hopefully EOF is done before DST, but I do think we need a standing EVM meeting to discuss the EVM proposals that flow in, like a subcommittee.  That would (a) get eyes on proposals like TSTORE sooner and (b) provide a carrot/stick to get clients to provisionally implement these things earlier and sus out problems (like the initcode constructor issue) that only show up when the whole stack is integrated.

author: lightclient
content: agreed - will let other folks review the time a bit longer and then will create the meeting and agenda in a few hours

author: lightclient
content: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/705

author: _shemnon
content: One of the "ban introspection" alternatives was to allow [EXT]CODECOPY to only access data portions of the EOF.  Here's an alternate container format that would make that more efficient, and we could wire it into the constructor code issues as well and allow dangling data - https://hackmd.io/@shemnon/index_based_eof_container - although banning EXTCODECOPY into EOF I think is still viable.

author: big_tech_sux
content: i think it would be good to get MCOPY into shanghai or cancun

author: big_tech_sux
content: seems like an easy win

author: _shemnon
content: I think we need to make sure we are done "cutting" from legacy EVM first.  MCOPY is a conflict-free add so it can easily slip out into Prague, my focus would be on removing opcodes and undesired functionality first.  This may be the only window in years we have to do it

author: big_tech_sux
content: well - because it's conflict free, doesn't that mean it is easy to coordinate with other changes?

author: _shemnon
content: There's a limited amount of dev time and "space" to make changes.  easy to coordinate != free

author: gcolvin
content: It's true that for most users I/O is where the time goes, but that's not why we try to maximize VM speed.  We do that for the small number of users who need high-performance code.  Anything we have to do on every instruction hurts them.
